title: Silicon Valley is politically homeless – and the establishment should be wary
text:
The message couldn’t have been any clearer. “Break up Big Tech” screamed a colossal billboard which appeared one morning a few months ago opposite San Francisco’s main railway station, where thousands of tech workers catch the daily double decker CalTrain down to Silicon Valley.

Beside it was a giant picture of Elizabeth Warren, the bespectacled Democratic Senator whose presidential campaign paid for it.

For Silicon Valley, America’s most liberal industry, Warren seems like an unlikely bogeywoman.

A diehard progressive Democrat who encapsulates many of the values its left-leaning employees hold dear, Warren’s own husband even worked for IBM – one of its biggest players.

But the visceral tensions...
description: The message couldn’t have been any clearer.
